body.name: Acer SH242Y Ebmihux 23.8" Full HD 1920 x 1080 Home Office Ultra-Thin Monitor AMD FreeSync 1ms VRB 100Hz Zero Frame Height Adjustable Stand with Swivel & Tilt (USB Type-C & HDMI 1.4 Ports)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 3 hrs 20 mins
features: 23.8" Full HD (1920 x 1080) Widescreen IPS Ultra-Thin Monitor | AMD FreeSync Technology
Refresh Rate: 100Hz | Response Time: 1ms VRB | Brightness: 250 nits | Pixel Pitch: 0.274mm
Zero-Frame Design | Color Saturation: NTSC 72% | 2 speakers, 1 watt per speaker
Tilt: -5 degrees to 25 degrees | Height Adjustment Range: 3.15" | Swivel: +/- 360°
USB Type-C Port: 1 x USB 3.1 (Type-C) port (Gen 1 up to 5 Gbps) supporting data, power (65W) and DisplayPort over USB-C
Ports: 1 x HDMI 1.4 Port & 1 x Audio-Out (USB Type-C and HDMI Cable Included)
body.description: In competitive gaming, every frame matters. Introducing Acer's SH242Y gaming monitor - the Full HD resolution monitor that can keep up with your game play. Through AMD FreeSync technology, the game’s frame rate is determined by your graphics card, not the fixed refresh rate of the monitor, giving you a serious competitive edge. Plus, users can enjoy comfortable viewing experience while gaming via flicker-less and low dimming display. The design saves space on your desk and lets you place multiple monitors side by side to build a seamless big-screen display. (UM.QS2AA.E06)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish, Slim, and Superb Display Quality
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded my home office setup with the Acer SB220Q bi 21.5-inch Full HD monitor, and I am ecstatic with the choice. The first thing that caught my eye was the ultra-slim design and the Zero Frame, which not only looks modern and sleek but also maximizes the screen space, providing more viewing area.The display quality is crisp and clear with vibrant colors, thanks to the Full HD resolution (1920 x 1080) and IPS technology. The images and texts appear sharp, making it a joy to work on documents, browse the web, or even enjoy videos and casual gaming during breaks.The monitor tilts from -5° to 15°, allowing me to find a comfortable viewing angle. It's a small but important feature that has made my workspace ergonomically friendly.The setup was a breeze. The monitor was easy to assemble and connect to my computer. I also appreciate the HDMI and VGA ports which provide flexibility in connections.One feature that stands out is the AMD Radeon FreeSync technology. It has significantly reduced screen tearing and stuttering, which is a big plus when I switch to gaming mode.The 75Hz refresh rate is a nice step up from the standard 60Hz, providing smoother motion on screen. It's not a gaming-centric monitor, but it handles casual gaming quite well.Moreover, the Acer SB220Q bi is gentle on the eyes with its flicker-free technology and blue light filter, which are essential features for someone like me who spends long hours in front of the screen.In a nutshell, the Acer SB220Q bi 21.5-inch monitor is a fantastic value for the price. It offers a stylish design, excellent display quality, and essential features that enhance usability and comfort. It's a great addition to my home office and I highly recommend it to anyone in need of a reliable, good-looking monitor without breaking the bank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a very, very nice monitor at a very nice price.
reviews.reviewText: What an excellent monitor at a reasonable cost! The first one impressed me so much that I purchased a second. Now I am working with two monitors of the same size and quality in my office. The picture is sharp and clear, and the speakers on this "ultra-thin" monitor are adequate. With an adjustable height, the stand tilts to meet your needs. The frame is barely perceptible, and the picture extends to nearly every edge around. Setup was very easy. There are no drivers. This is a plug-and-play device with VGA and HDMI options. This monitor is very, very nice, and it is very reasonably priced.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Budget Monitor!
reviews.reviewText: This review is for the SB220Q series (1920x1080) 75Hz monitor variant. At a $90 price point as of July 2020, all of the praise this monitor has gotten and continues to get is pretty well deserved. Right out of the box the factory calibration is pretty awful as with most TVs and monitors (I’ll never understand why that is), but Acer’s built-in menu gives you a wide range of control to tweak the image quality to your liking. Here are some of the most noticeable Pros & Cons after using this monitor daily for the past three weeks:PROS:- The colors can be very vibrant and the sharpness makes everything nice and crisp both up close and from a distance without going overboard. Although the spec sheet does not specify the exact Adobe or sRGB color gamut range, it does have a stated 72% NTSC coverage (keep in mind that the NTSC color gamut has the highest level of color reproduction), which would imply that it should have close to 100% sRGB coverage. This is pretty standard for most sub $200 monitors (note: the unit that TechSpot tested came in at around 93% of sRGB coverage mostly losing detail in the green range so your unit’s reproduction may vary). The 6-bits + FRC (equal to 8-bits) color depth is also an industry standard for entry level monitors and is completely fine for casual use.- This montior’s “100,000,000:1” Dynamic Contrast Ratio (DCR) (non-standardized measure of contrast for videos) definitely seems to outperform my other slightly more expensive budget IPS monitors (the HP VH240a and ViewSonic VS2412-H) that only have 20,000,000:1 and 50,000,000:1 contrast ratios respectively. However, note that it still has an industry standard 1000:1 Static Contrast Ratio (measure for non-moving images) which isn’t great but is perfectly acceptable for casual viewing since only the highest tiered ($400+) IPS panels exceed that point with 1,500:1 being the maximum native contrast typically achievable with an IPS.~ A quick side note about that “100,000,000:1” DCR number: there is no industry standard methodology for this particular measurement so the number itself is mostly useless marketing fluff. But as I noted, compared to the two other monitors with the same industry standard SCR, this monitor did seem to outperform them both in that area.- Its 102 PPI pixel density actually makes a subtle difference in image quality when viewing up close compared to my 24 inch 1080p monitors that have a 92 PPI. Text seems to be a bit smoother in comparison. This is purely an advantage of having the smaller 21.5 inch screen.- The Color Adjustment Menu allows you to adjust both the RGB and CMY gains, bias, hues, and saturation levels to get a better color balance.- The Picture Menu lets you adjust the screen’s brightness, contrast, gamma, and blackness (“black boost”) levels while also providing a ‘blue light’, ‘adaptive constrast’ (ACM), and a ‘Super Sharpness’ on/off switch.- The Game Menu has FreeSync (for AMD GPUs) and Overdrive optionsCONS:- The bezels are a bit thicker than I woud’ve liked (they’re about 1 cm on the top, left, and right sides) making the frameless design nothing more than a gimmick.- The top-down viewing angle is noticeably darker compared to looking at the screen head on.- Despite having a good DCR of 100M:1, the blacks are still a bit too bright for watching anything with heavy dark scenes since the display itself does not have any HDR capabilities with high contrast control zones aka local dimming (to be fair, this is completely expected at this $90 price point and is only being mentioned as reference for those that may be thinking of using this monitor to watch TV/movies).- The Picture Menu’s ‘Super Sharpness’ option is just an on/off switch; it does not give you a more granular adjustment control over the amount of sharpness to apply.- Even with all of the image quality adjustment options available in the settings, the whites remain on the slightly warmer side of the color temperature chart. It’s not that noticeable when viewing on this monitor alone, but the difference can be seen if you have another slightly cooler display adjacent to it. This is most likely just an issue with my particular unit since other reviews have noted their unit had a more neutral or “near perfect” white temp.- It only has a paltry 15° degree back tilt compared to most other budget monitors being able to tilt closer to 30° degrees (this is super nitpicky as compromises are to be expected at a sub $100 price point).- The Power button is completely indistinguishable from the rest of the menu buttons (both in shape and spacing).Overall, if you’re looking for a nice quality budget monitor to look at spreadsheets, word documents, and do some internet browsing or even some light casual gaming, then this is a great choice. If you are a competitive gamer, photographer, professional editor, or a content creator then you’ll obviously need to invest in a higher spec monitor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars No built in speakers
reviews.reviewText: Don't gete wrong here. This is a Fantastic monitor for the price. It looks good. It lightweight but very sturdy. Picture quality is great! It won't tilt forward tho but that's not a problem for me. However, it is listed as having built in speakers which it does not. Great value for the money!
Bought this to game on with switch and Xbox, works amazing and great picture quality! I do wish it had more than one HDMI port, but the cord clip make it easy so switch HDMI cords when needed.

Utilizo el monitor como monitor externo a una Mac Air. Quedó fácilmente instalado y la calidad de la imagen es buena, así como el brillo y las opciones para configurarlo a tus necesidades. Lo utilizo para tareas de oficina así que sus características se adaptan a estas necesidades y para eso lo pensé. Hay que tener en cuenta que el monitor es fijo; es decir, no puede subirse o bajarse, ni cambiar la inclinación, quizá este sea el único detalle que no me agradó. Pero tampoco entorpece en nada sus funciones generales. Buen monitor para el precio. Si lo buscas para otros fines, quizá deberías optar por otra opción.

This monitor really knocked my socks off! I was expecting just another monitor, like my old one. I needed a new one for my wife so I grabbed this. It isn't kidding when they say it is thin. It's very light weight, which doesn't matter to me much. The colour quality is top notch and response is perfect, no blurriness or anything. But what surprised me is that I will sometimes watch videos on it, and when I do, I will move to a livingroom chair I have in the corner to watch it which sits lower. With my old monitor that would make the video much darker and I would have to adjust it so that the monitor was facing almost directly at me to get a good image. With this one, I sat down and the image was just fine without even turning it or angling it down or anything!!! It didn't get darker, very minimal glare on it. The black is nice and black like it should be (with some nice options in the monitor settings to adjust the blackness). It has a ton of settings for the monitor. The refresh rate of 75 is nice. I'm a casual gamer and it is perfect for that, the colours in my game really looked nice. I can't say enough about this, I was FINALLY pleasantly surprised (as opposed to so much I have purchased that didn't work). Well worth the money by far!

Me gustó que tenga el panel ips ya que lograron que la gama de colores sea contundente, se notan los 75Hz se ven muy bien al jugar, es pequeña, pero se ve bastante nítida; obviamente no alcanza la potencia de uno de mayor calidad, pero considero que es de bastante buena calidad para el precio, gracias.
